page.title: 05WILD LIFE _ CONGRESBURY YEO
page.content: The wild life is that appropriate to open countryside and coastal areas.It is possible to find sea fish such as bass,cod,mullet and eels on the coast and in the estury of the Congresbury Yeo as far upstream as the sluices.In the fresh water ditches roach,eels, tench and trout are found. The bird population also reflects the special qualities of the area.Heron and duck are frequently seen around the rhines and the usual wild birds such as sparrows,blackbirds,thrushes, and magpies live in the trees and hedgerows.Sea gulls live on the shore. Plants and insects suited to the countryside abound.Grasses suited to salty soil grow between the two sea walls.Wild iris,meadow sweet,and bullrushes grow along the ditches.Meadow flowers grow in the hedgerows and verges.
